results.title: Health habits for a healthy life
results.creator_credit: Ron Casden, James Ganzer and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Explains, through animation, the physiological workings of the cardiac, circulatory, and respiratory systems. Outlines and stresses the importance of the pyramid of health, which includes proper nutrition, regular exercise, and social well-being. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: Me depressed?: don't make me laugh
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Christine Mason and Monkey See Productions
results.brief_description: Beneath Spike Milligan’s comedic career lay a severe and debilitating depression, and he is the perfect candidate to present this helpful video on depression and ways of treating it. He speaks with sufferers as well as experts, providing a useful tool for sufferers, family and friends, and health professionals. Included on this tape are; types of depression, the importance of daily activity, charting the rise and fall of moods, controlling negative thoughts, the role of medication, the role of family and friends, suicide, and where to go for help.

results.title: Bull Durham
results.creator_credit: Ron Shelton, Mark Burg, Thom Mount and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins turn in seriously sexy performances in this sensational baseball comedy. Charged with pulling the Durham Bulls ou of the longest losing streak in Carolina’s Baseball League history, Crash Davis’ (Costner) main challenge is to instruct, insult and inspire Eddie ‘Nuke’ Calvin (Robbins), their indisciplined but bullet-fast pitcher. Sarandon is the team’s groupie-cum-English Lit teacher who becomes the fly in the ointment after she catches Nuke’s eye and begins to distract him from Crash’s tuition with her own slightly bizarre set of off-field rules.

results.title: The Little ark
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz and Cinema Center Films
results.brief_description: Two children in Holland, Jan Brink and Adinda de la Maison are orphaned after they are separated from their parents when a flood washes away their town. They are picked up by an Urker sea captain, along with the pets they have salvaged from the flood; a cat, rabbit, rooster and a dog. The captain proves to be a captivating story teller with the ability to teach values such as love and respect through his stories. Starring Monica Achterberg, Genevieve Ambas, Philip Frame and Theodore Bikel as the captain. Filmed entirely in Holland and based on the novel by Jan De Hartog.

results.brief_description: Daniel Defoe’s famous adventure story is brought to life by the distinct style of the Italian animator, Gibba. Screen adaptation and script by Alan Thornton, Albert Chimenz, Frank Driver and Antony Victor. Dialogue by Alan Thornton.

results.title: Brimstone & treacle
results.creator_credit: Richard Loncraine, Kenith Trodd and Namara
results.brief_description: A strange young man, Martin Taylor (Sting), infiltrates his way into the family of a vulnerable middle aged couple Tom and Nora Bates (Joan Plowright and Denholm Elliot). Martin becomes infatuated with their daughter Patricia (Suzanne Hamilton), who has been comatose for 4 years. The part angel, part devil Martin, mysteriously rouses sleeping beauty from her slumber. Adapted from the play by Dennis Potter, this film is bizarre to say the least and was banned by the BBC shortly after being taped.

results.title: The Card
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, Clive Donner, John Bryan and British Film-Makers Limited
results.brief_description: Edward Henry Machin (Alec Guinness), Denry for short, has been determined from youth to master his own fate. He uses his powers of persuasion and deception to cajole his way to fame and fortune, but still manages to remain friends with everyone. Affectionately known as ‘The Card’, Denry’s ultimate coup occurs when he becomes the youngest mayor of his home town of Bursley. Denry is not without female companionship, and his life is influenced by three women; a Countess, a dancing teacher, and the councillor’s daughter. It is through his relationship with these women that his deceptive ways are exposed. Also starring Glynis Johns, Valerie Hobson and Petula Clark. Based on the novel by Arnold Bennett and screenplay by Eric Ambler. Also known as “The Promoter”.

results.title: Rambling Rose
results.creator_credit: Martha Coolidge, Renny Harlin and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: The traditional Southern values of the upstanding Hillyer family are about to be challenged. They’ve just hired a 19-year-old Rose (Laura Dern) as a housekeeper and nanny, unaware of the hilarious disruptions her arrival will cause. The very sweet and kind Rose has uncontrollable sexual impulses which cause her to ramble from man to man, bed to bed, leaving a trail of catastrophes in her wake.

results.title: Shadowlands
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Brian Eastman and Spelling Films International
results.brief_description:
Shadowlands is an absorbing and moving story of true love. British writer C. S. Lewis, whose comfortable but rigid life as an Oxford don in the 1950’s is shaken by his meeting with a forthright poet, American Joy Gresham. She knew him from his books and he remembered her from her letters, but when they finally met, she was unlike any-one he had ever known. Like his writings, his love for Joy is captivating and magical. A story for everyone, made with uncommon intelligence and restraint.
Cast includes: Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger and Julian Fellowes
